question: [File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Timer accuracy] Can the BLOCK_PARTITIONING_SECONDS timer be exploited to leak timing information about transaction contents? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Metrics overhead] Can excessive metric collection in MISC_TIMERS_SECONDS cause performance degradation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Constructor: new()] [Arc reference counting] Can the Arc<ThreadPool> be cloned excessively, causing memory issues when many PartitionerV2 instances exist? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [State Arc sharing] Is the Arc<ThreadPool> safely shared across multiple concurrent partition() calls, or can this cause contention? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Output consistency] Can the returned PartitionedTransactions have internal inconsistencies that cause execution errors? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Transaction count preservation] Does partition() guarantee that all input transactions appear exactly once in the output, or can transactions be duplicated or dropped? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Dependency graph validity] Can the output dependency graph contain cycles, invalid indices, or other structural problems? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Sub-block ordering] Is the ordering of sub-blocks within each shard deterministic and consistent across validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Tracker consistency] Can the ConflictingTxnTracker internal state become inconsistent if mark_txn_ordered() is called out of order? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [BTreeSet operations] Can the BTreeSet operations in ConflictingTxnTracker cause performance issues with very large pending sets? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Anchor shard bias] Can biased anchor_shard_id assignments cause load imbalance, reducing parallelism effectiveness? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Execution compatibility] Can the partitioner output be incompatible with the executor's expectations, causing execution failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Sharded execution assumptions] Does the partitioner make assumptions about executor behavior that could be violated? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Global executor placement] If partition_last_round is false, does the global executor receive the correct transaction set? (High)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Constructor: new()] [Rayon panic handling] Does Rayon properly propagate panics from worker threads, or can silent failures occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Nested parallelism] Can nested parallel operations in init(), remove_cross_shard_dependencies(), build_index_from_txn_matrix(), and add_edges() cause thread pool exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Work stealing overhead] Can Rayon's work stealing mechanism cause excessive overhead with fine-grained parallel tasks? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Constructor: new()] [Unwrap safety] Is the unwrap() at line 119 safe, or can ThreadPoolBuilder::build() legitimately fail? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Unwrap in loops] Are all the unwrap() calls in the tracker update loop at lines 162-168 safe from panics? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: extract_and_sort()] [Unwrap on write lock] Can the write().unwrap() at line 200 panic if the lock is poisoned from a previous panic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Maximum shard count] What happens if num_executor_shards exceeds the number of transactions - does each transaction get its own shard inefficiently? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Minimum shard count] Can num_executor_shards be 1, effectively disabling parallelism? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/execution/block-partitioner/src/v2/mod.rs] [Function: partition()] [Round exhaustion] What happens if all num_rounds_limit rounds are used but conflicts still remain? (High)
